title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Akron (Akron, OH) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: Since the job was python related had to demonstrate a small demonstration of Web related framework like Django and code in python with out any external libraries. It was an average one.
Interview Questions: Build a sample Django application

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Akron (Akron, OH) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: Called me via phone for a job interview. It wasn't a complex process. There is nothing to worry about. You will be fine. Be calm and answer all the questions they have asked. Those will be easy one.
Interview Questions: How would you handle an angry client?

title: PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Akron
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is pretty straight forward. You just meet w/ different faculty members. They show you around campus, feed you and you get to meet many other students that are already in the dept.
Interview Questions: Why akron?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Akron (Akron, OH) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: It was an informal interview session with a director, who explained the mission of the department to a group of students and answered questions. We learned about initiatives and projects, then were asked what skills we had that we could bring to the table. We were told to send in our resumes to be evaluated. A group of people chose from students' resumes and interviews to pick out the student assistant to be hired.
Interview Questions: What would you change about the University?

title: Student Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Akron (Akron, OH) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: A one time three person interview. Allot of "what if" and scenarios questions. The interview lasted around 30 minutes. After telling me a did a good job, I was notified a day later that I had received the position.
Interview Questions: How would you handle an emergency medical situation?

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Akron (Akron, OH)
Interview Descriptions: I was applied for the graduate program. Was asked to submit all academic transcripts. Then I was called by the department chair and interviewed by him. Then I was interviewed by the subject professor. He asked me general questions and some questions about the subject. Then I was given a student's copy to grade. It was easy and the teacher was very helpful towards me.
Interview Questions: How would you manage a student who asks you to solve his homework?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Akron in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: I uploaded my resume to the online job board. Once I began the Fall semester (2015) I was called and offered to come in for an interview. This was an opportunity by chance mostly because my hours of availability were what they were looking for.
Interview Questions: The main questions were my hours of availability and how long I expected to remain at the school before I graduated.

title: Doctoral Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of Akron
Interview Descriptions: Contacting faculty members and attaching CV to find a research position. Waiting for their response and apply for it. After getting admission from Grad School, we have to sign contract with department to get the stipend and other compensations.
Interview Questions: They usually ask about our research experiences.

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Akron (Akron, OH) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was pretty standard. Phone interview first, then in person interviews. It was nice because they introduced me to a lot of people during my in person interview on campus
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work in college athletics?

title: Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 6 days. I interviewed at University of Akron (Akron, OH) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was an informal interview process. I had to have a class grade of B+ or greater in order to tutor the specific class. As long as you meet those guidelines you will be hired as a tutor.
Interview Questions: What is your GPA?

title: Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Akron (Akron, OH) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: This was just a standard interview process. Normal questions about yourself and the position for which I applied. There was nothing spectacular about the interview that stood out to mention.
Interview Questions: What makes you qualified for this possession?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Akron (Akron, OH) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions:
We need to look on the Professor's website and if we like their research ,we need to approach them by taking a appointment thereafter He will have alook on our resume and he explains his project.
He may ask some questions and tell us how to be in his lab,after that he may offer the job.
Interview Questions: How many hours you can work in this lab?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Akron (Akron, OH) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: It was simple. I collected the letters of recommendation I needed and submitted my application. I was called by the chairman of the department that was interested in me and we talked about my work history. He liked my experience and told me I got the job if I wanted it.
Interview Questions: Describe your responsibilities working at [insert employer here].

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Akron in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: They emailed me about the position, I replied and was immediately interviewed. The interview process was a 1:1 situation in which they assessed my character and likeability. No specific skills were mentioned in the interview. Basically, they just wanted to find out if I was somebody they would enjoy working with on a daily basis.
Interview Questions: Are you prepared to greet and talk to strangers on a daily basis?

title: Athletics Development Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Akron (Akron, OH) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: I applied for the position of Athletics Development Assistant. I was called in and asked to come in for an interview in which i agreed. I sat down with the Director of the Z-fund and we started with a chat about myself and why i was interested in the position. She then asked me multiple questions about my knowledge of fundraising and why i wanted this role.
Interview Questions: What do I know about the donor cycle?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Akron
Interview Descriptions: There isn't an interview process, per se.  I did have to write a letter to the department head about why I thought I deserved the assistantship position.  The letter had to be one page, typed.  The decision on who to give the assistantship to is based on a combination of GPA and the written letter.
Interview Questions: As stated above, there is not an interview process.  The only question asked was to write a letter detailing why I deserved the position.

title: Administrative Staff Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Akron (Akron, OH)
Interview Descriptions: Begins with online application.  Panel interviews are a variety of search committee members and co-workers.  The panel begins with a predetermined list of questions and then concludes with any supplemental questions the panel wishes to ask.  Depending on the job, may have to prove computer skills by testing your ability to type a letter, create an excel spreadsheet, etc.
Interview Questions: Most questions relate to interpersonal skills.  Nothing outrageous or unexpected is asked.

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Akron
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process was quite simple due my status as a student. I found the job on the student jobs website and called the office for an interview.  After the interview I was hired and filled out my schedule.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Akron (Akron, OH) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: My interview process was short and sweet. I found the position posted on the university's website, applied, and received a call about a week later. I went in about two days after that and had an interview, which only lasted probably 10 minutes total. I was contacted a few days after that and was offered a position, which I gladly accepted.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a situation in which an angry student came in and was talking disrespectfully towards you?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Akron (Akron, OH) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: Three interviewers who later became future bosses sat around a table with me to ask questions, in turn, related to future job tasks and about myself.  This entire process took approximately 45 mins and was like a more informal Q & A.
Interview Questions: The questions asked were based around specific characteristics that were important to the job, with an expected response based off of a specific experience that exemplified that characteristic

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Akron (Akron, OH) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: The hiring and interviewing process was pretty quick and simple. I emailed the person hiring for the position with my resume and my school schedule. I received a follow up email from her about interviewing information. The interview was pretty simple, she asked me a few questions and gave me a tour of the Career Center at the time as well as introduced me to the different advisers who worked there.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have with upset clients?

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Akron (Akron, OH) in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions: Typical Academic Process
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Akron (Akron, OH) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: I found the job on the school's website and sent in my resume, they called for an interview. Short Interview with supervisor, not a skilled position so no problems. They were quick to reply and were pretty easy going.
Interview Questions: How open is my school schedule?

title: Engineering Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Akron (Akron, OH) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: Nothing mentionable. As usual as following TOEFL, GRE etc.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Graduate Assistants Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Akron (Akron, OH) in Nov 2011
Interview Descriptions: Based on your scores
Interview Questions: every thing was expected

title: College Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Akron (Akron, OH) in Aug 2011
Interview Descriptions: I knew someone there.  A friend had the job and recommended that I take her place.  I already had a powerful resume and had been teaching in other college institutions before.
Interview Questions: They asked me if I wanted to work there.  They hired me because I was already teaching at other colleges.  You do part time at many colleges to earn a decent income.

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Akron (Akron, OH) in Jul 2011
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview then met face to face to discuss the project
Interview Questions: What are your experiences?

title: Lab Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Akron (Akron, OH) in Jun 2011
Interview Descriptions: Short but to the point. Laid back. I feel like there was a lot of questions. They all did not pertain to the job. It was at the University of Akron.
Interview Questions: How do your skills apply to this position?

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Akron (Akron, OH) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: it start from phone interview and than 1:1 in person interview.
Interview Questions: What is your contribution for our school?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Akron (Akron, OH) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: i contact the computer lab supervisor and i gave him my resume. then i contacted him via email to check the application process. then they schedule an interview to confirm the information in my resume. then in the same day they told me to follow up at the end of that day to check the result. and they offer me the job.
Interview Questions: What programming language you know?

title: Lifeguard Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Akron (Akron, OH) in Dec 2010
Interview Descriptions: I took the lifeguarding class through the university of akron. the interview wasnt much more than doing well in the class and passing all of the swim tests, CPR AED training etc. the people who do the hiring interview are the ones who teach the class so you will get to know them and they will get to know you. by the time the class is over if you want the job and did well you should have no problem getting hired. its basically can you pass these tests, if yes you have a job
Interview Questions: there were no difficult questions. like i said it is pretty straight forward. they just want to make sure you know how to perform the necessary duties and want to make sure you are capable of doing your job.

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Akron (Akron, OH) in Feb 2008
Interview Descriptions: It is just a phone interview.
Interview Questions: Why do you choose this school?
